revision.text:
{{Infobox museum | name = Zone 5 Military Museum | native_name = Bao Tang Quan Khu 5 | native_name_lang = vn | image = Entrance to Zone 5 Military Museum.JPG | caption = Entrance to Zone 5 Military Museum | alt = | map_type = Vietnam | map_caption = | map_size = | latitude = 16.0487 | longitude = 108.2177 | coordinates_type = | coordinates_region = | coordinates_display = | coordinates_format = | coordinates = {{Coord|16.0487|108.2177|region:VN_type:landmark|display=title,inline}} | established = | dissolved = | location = 3 Duy Tân, [[Da Nang]], Vietnam | type = Military museum | collection = | visitors = | director = | president = | curator = | owner = [[Government of Vietnam]] | publictransit = | car_park = | network = | website = }} The '''Zone 5 Military Museum''' (Bao Tang Khu 5) is a military [[museum]] located at 3 Duy Tân, [[Da Nang]], Vietnam. It covers all Vietnamese resistance to foreign occupation from the Chinese occupation, the [[First Indochina War]] with the French, the [[Vietnam War]] and the current standoff with China over the [[Spratly Islands]] and the [[Paracel Islands]].
The Museum's opening hours are from 07:30 to 10:30 and from 13:30 to 16:30 daily except Monday. Admission is free for Vietnamese and [[Vietnamese dong|VND]] 60,000 for non-Vietnamese, plus VND 10,000 to take photos.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.baodanang.vn/english/danang-attractions/201305/Military-Zone-5-branch-of-the-Ho-Chi-Minh-Museum-and-the-Military-Museum-2242505/|title=Military Zone 5 branch of the Ho Chi Minh Museum and the Military Museum|publisher=Danang Today|date=22 May 2013|accessdate=27 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.danang.gov.vn/portal/page/portal/danang/english/tourism/mus?p_pers_id=&p_folder_id=16413842&p_main_news_id=28868959&p_year_sel=|title=Ho Chi Minh Museum and Military Zone No 5 Museum|publisher=Danang City Government|accessdate=27 August 2014}}</ref>
==History==
{{Empty section|date=August 2014}}
==Exhibits== The museum complex comprises four main sections: an outdoor display of large military equipment; a military museum; a reproduction of [[Presidential Palace, Hanoi#Ho Chi Minh's Stilt House|Ho Chi Minh's house]] in [[Hanoi]]; and a [[Ho Chi Minh]] Museum.
===Outdoor display=== Items on display: *[[100 mm field gun M1944 (BS-3)]] produced in Czechoslovakia *[[Cessna A-37 Dragonfly]] ''10793'' light aircraft captured at [[Da Nang Air Base]] on March 29, 1975 and later used in the [[Bombing of Tan Son Nhut Air Base]] *[[BLU-82]] "Daisy Cutter" bomb recovered from [[An Lão District]] in 2006 * Soviet-built Bulldozers (2) *[[Cessna O-1 Bird Dog]] ''042'' captured in 1975 and subsequently used in the early stages of the [[Cambodian–Vietnamese War]] *[[M8 Greyhound]] armoured car captured from Groupe Mobile 100 in the [[Battle of Mang Yang Pass]] *[[130 mm towed field gun M1954 (M-46)|M-46]] 130mm towed field gun *[[M41 Walker Bulldog|M41 tank]] used by the ARVN 14th Armored Cavalry Regiment and captured at [[Tân Cảnh Base Camp|Tân Cảnh]] during the [[Battle of Kontum#The Loss of Tan Canh|Battle of Kontum]] in May 1972 *[[M48 Patton|M48A3 Patton tank]] used by the ARVN 1st Cavalry Brigade and captured at Danang on March 29, 1975 *[[M101 howitzer]] (2) captured in [[Bình Định Province]] in 1972 *[[M102 howitzer]] captured in April 1975 *[[M107 self-propelled gun]] captured at Da Nang in March 1975 *[[M113 armored personnel carrier]] captured in 1975 and subsequently used in the Cambodian–Vietnamese War *[[M114 155 mm howitzer]] captured in 1954 in the Battle of Mang Yang Pass *[[122 mm howitzer M1938 (M-30)|M1938 122mm howitzer]] used by VPA Brigade 52 to attack the ARVN base in [[Minh Long District]] in 1974 *[[M1939]] 37mm anti-aircraft gun used by VPA Regiment 573 it apparently shot down an A-37 in [[Tiên Phước District]] on 17 March 1975 *[[160mm Mortar M1943|M1943 160mm mortar]] used by VPA Regiment 576 to attack the ARVN base in Minh Long District in 1974 *[[M578 Light Recovery Vehicle]] captured in 1975 *[[MiG-21]] ''5114'' of the VPAF 931st Regiment used by Nguyen Van Nghia to shoot down a US [[McDonnell Douglas F-4 Phantom II]] over Bac Thai in 1972 *MiG-21 ''5127'' of the VPAF 931st Regiment used by Le Khuong *[[P-15 Termit]] antiship missile *[[QF 3.7-inch mountain howitzer]] captured from the French in [[Bình Thuận Province]] in 1953 *[[SA-2]] Guideline SAM, used by Regiment 275, Air Defence Division 375 *[[T-34|T34/85]] tank used in [[Operation Lam Son 719]] *Toyota pickup mounting a [[recoilless rifle]] captured in the Cambodian-Vietnamese War *[[Bell UH-1 Iroquois]] helicopter ''69-15130'' captured in 1975 and subsequently used in the Cambodian–Vietnamese War *[[ZIL-157]] general purpose truck
===Military Museum=== Displays include: *memorials to Ho Chi Minh and [[Võ Nguyên Giáp]] *memorials to the leaders and heroes of the Zone 5 Military *memorials to mothers whose only children or multiple children were killed during the Vietnam War *photographic display of Vietnam's historic claims to the Trường Sa (Spratley) and Hoàng Sa (Paracel) Islands *opposition to the French in [[Nha Trang]] in October 1946 *the Battle of Mang Yang Pass *[[Battle of Ba Gia]] *[[Operation Starlite]] *[[Battle of Ia Drang]] *[[Hue–Da Nang Campaign]] *Operations against [[FULRO]]
==Gallery==
